name: troubleshoot
content:

to discover why something does not work effectively and help to improve it: They brought me in to troubleshoot - to go in, sort out the problem, and get out again. A top German engineer has been appointed to troubleshoot the cause of the accident. See
troubleshooting
More examplesFewer examplesYou can usually troubleshoot the problem by looking for a few commonly occurring causes.She is lacking the proper computer skills and was unable to help me troubleshoot my issue.I’d suggest posting the details and we can try to troubleshoot more easily.

to try to solve problems for a person or organization: She meets daily with various stakeholders to troubleshoot any issues or potential problems.
to try to find the cause of a product or system not working correctly, especially one involving a piece of equipment or machine, and try to find the solution: Service technicians will continue to learn about and troubleshoot the equipment. The company's help site explains how to set up and troubleshoot your DSL modem. troubleshooting noun [ U ]
If you have any queries there is a menu for troubleshooting on the website.
